item.title: Brent add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "There are teachers and students with square minds who are by nature meant to undergo the fascination of catagories. For them, 'schools' and 'movements' are everything; by painting a group symbol on the brow of mediocrity, they condone their own incomprehension of true genius." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Brent add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Do not, do not, do not books for ever hammer at people like perpetual bells? When, between two books, silent sky appears: be glad " -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Brent add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "There's something vile (and all the more vile because ridiculous) in the tendency of feeble men to make universal tragedies out of the sad comedies of their private woes." -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: Brent add a quote by Sam Lipsyte
item.description: "I bought an energy bar, and as I ate it a great weariness came over me." -- Sam Lipsyte

item.title: Brent add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "what makes a work of fiction safe from larvae and rust is not its social importance but its art, only its art" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Brent add a quote by Marcel Béalu
item.description: "Oh, how I longed to burst through the doors and go walking through the streets, with my hands open, like weapons!" -- Marcel Béalu
